author: Réseau International
title: Une autre histoire de Noël : Histoire vraie de 1944
text: - Soutenez Réseau International Nous avons besoin de vous par Fritz Vincken Cette histoire de Noël un peu différente montre clairement que les gens ne veulent pas de guerres. Elles sont sûrement fomentées de l’extérieur. Hiver 1944 en Allemagne. Beaucoup de gens près du Rhin pensaient que la guerre touchait à sa fin. C’est pourquoi le maître-boulanger Vincken avait fait venir sa famille bombardée, sa femme et son fils de douze ans, Fritz, près de chez lui, dans la forêt de Hürtgenwald, où il était astreint à faire du pain pour la Wehrmacht. Sur un camion à benne, il les a amenés, après des heures de route nocturne, dans une baraque vide, cachée dans une clairière. Mais le front s’est durci. En décembre, il y eut même une contre-offensive. Les deux continuèrent à patienter dans la cabane, recouverte d’une épaisse couche de neige. Mais le père avait de plus en plus de mal à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. C’est ainsi qu’arriva la veille de Noël 1944. Plus tard, son fils Fritz a écrit tout ce qui s’est passé. source : [Kla.TV](https://www.kla.tv/27781)

author: HispanTV
title: Irán entrega nota de protesta al enviado ruso tras controvertida declaración
text:
Irán convocó al encargado de negocios de Rusia en protesta por una declaración emitida por Rusia y varios países árabes sobre tres islas iraníes en el Golfo Pérsico.
El sábado, el encargado de negocios ruso fue convocado por el asistente del director general de Asuntos del Golfo Pérsico del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de Irán, tras la publicación de la declaración final del VI Foro de Cooperación Árabe-Ruso, llevado a cabo en Marruecos. En dicho foro, se reiteraron las infundadas afirmaciones de los Emiratos Árabes Unidos (EAU) sobre las tres islas iraníes de Bu Musa, Tonb Mayor y Tonb Menor.
Durante el encuentro, el diplomático iraní expresó la “enérgica protesta” de la República Islámica al respecto y entregó una nota de protesta al enviado ruso.
El funcionario del Ministerio de Asuntos Exteriores de Irán recordó al diplomático ruso “la necesidad de mostrar respeto por la soberanía e integridad territorial de todos los países, como uno de los principios más reconocidos y fundamentales en las relaciones internacionales”.
Irán recuerda a Rusia que no comprometerá su soberanía con nadie | HISPANTV Irán recuerda a Rusia que no comprometerá su soberanía y su integridad territorial con nadie, condenando así una declaración árabe-rusa sobre tres islas iraníes.
Además, reafirmó la postura firme de Teherán de que “las tres islas iraníes en el Golfo Pérsico pertenecen eternamente a Irán”, subrayando que “el Gobierno de la República Islámica de Irán considera nula y sin valor cualquier reclamación al respecto por parte de cualquier país”.
Por su parte, el diplomático ruso aseguró que trasladaría la protesta de Irán a las autoridades de su país con prontitud.

author: malvern-online.com
title: The Benefits of a Personalized Health Plan from the Center for Integrated Health | User | malvern-online.com
text:
Discover how the Center for Integrated Health’s personalized age management plans combine hormone therapy and gut health to support vitality and well-being as you age.
(PRUnderground) November 7th, 2024
As the pursuit of longevity and vitality grows, age management medicine has emerged as a way to help people thrive as they age. Instead of merely addressing symptoms or diseases as they appear, age management medicine focuses on optimizing health through a proactive, whole-body approach. At the Center for Integrated Health , a leader in integrative and holistic medicine, clients receive tailored treatment plans that incorporate age management, bio-identical hormone replacement therapy (BHRT), and comprehensive care, designed to support balance, longevity, and vitality throughout aging.
Understanding Age Management Medicine
Age management medicine is an innovative approach that aims to prevent age-related decline, support hormonal balance, and enhance well-being by focusing on proactive care. Unlike conventional medicine, which tends to treat health issues reactively, age management identifies potential health risks early on, addressing them through personalized care. At the Center for Integrated Health, age management involves assessing a patient’s health, lifestyle, and genetic predispositions to craft personalized plans. These plans may include BHRT, nutrition and exercise guidance, and support for gut health and mental well-being. By addressing each person holistically, age management ensures clients maintain vitality as they age.
The Importance of Personalized Health Plans
Aging affects everyone differently, making personalized health plans essential for effective age management. The Center for Integrated Health customizes each plan using comprehensive evaluations like advanced blood work, hormone testing, genetic screening, and lifestyle assessments. Personalization offers multiple advantages, including:
Targeted Treatment: With a deeper understanding of individual needs, personalized plans enable treatments that address underlying issues early. Efficiency: Tailored health plans eliminate guesswork, allowing patients to receive therapies that are truly beneficial. Holistic Care: Personalized plans consider physical, mental, and emotional health, helping clients achieve balance as they age. Sustainable Results: These plans are designed to address root causes, providing lasting vitality rather than temporary solutions. BHRT and Hormone Optimization
Hormone imbalances are common with aging, leading to symptoms like fatigue, mood swings, and low libido. BHRT, which uses hormones identical to those naturally produced by the body, is an effective treatment for these symptoms. The Center for Integrated Health uses BHRT in personalized age management plans for both men and women, optimizing hormones for improved energy, cognitive function, and emotional well-being.
For Women: BHRT helps alleviate menopause symptoms, such as hot flashes and mood changes, by restoring estrogen and progesterone levels. For Men: BHRT restores testosterone levels, enhancing energy, muscle mass, and libido. Hormone optimization supports vital systems like the heart, bones, and brain, making it foundational for longevity.
Gut Health: Vital to Well-Being
A healthy gut is key to longevity and overall health. Responsible for nutrient absorption, hormone production, and immune regulation, gut health often declines with age due to factors like diet and stress. At the Center for Integrated Health, gut health is a priority in every health plan. Strategies for gut optimization include:
Nutritional Guidance: Diets tailored to individual needs reduce inflammation and support gut health. Probiotics and Supplements: These restore gut balance for better digestion and immunity. Stress Management: Techniques like mindfulness and yoga protect gut health by reducing stress. Comprehensive Whole-Body Care
At the Center for Integrated Health, age management extends beyond symptom treatment to whole-body wellness, addressing:
Mental Health: Personalized plans may include mindfulness, ketamine therapy, or low-dose naltrexone (LDN) for mental well-being. Exercise and Mobility: Exercise plans maintain muscle, bone density, and cardiovascular health. Stress Reduction: Techniques help manage chronic stress, a contributor to accelerated aging. A Path to Aging Well
With personalized age management plans that combine hormone therapy, gut health support, and whole-body care, the Center for Integrated Health helps clients maintain energy, mental clarity, and overall well-being. By addressing hormonal balance, gut health, and mental wellness, age management medicine offers a comprehensive approach to longevity. Ready to take control of your health? Contact the Center for Integrated Health to begin your journey to aging well.
About Center for Integrated Health
Carol Banyas, M.D., Ph. D., is a unique physician, therapist, teacher, and healer. She has dedicated her life and career to practicing traditional, eastern, and functional medicine with a focus on natural supplementation that caters to natural healing, longevity, and resilience of the human body. She is a pioneer in a new paradigm of healing in the Psychiatric, Medical, and Psycho-therapeutic communities by synthesizing traditional medical understandings with the deeper causes of disease. You may contact her here: https://carolbanyasmd.com/contact/
The post The Benefits of a Personalized Health Plan from the Center for Integrated Health first appeared on
Press Contact Name: DR. CAROL BANYAS Phone: (925) 838-2138 Email: Contact Us Original Press Release .

author: Al Jazeera
title: Israel launches new Lebanon attacks despite growing calls for ceasefire
text:
Dozens of people have been killed in Israeli attacks across Lebanon, health authorities said, as Israeli air forces expanded their bombardment of the country for a fourth consecutive day despite growing international calls for a ceasefire.
According to an Al Jazeera tally, Lebanon’s Ministry of Public Health reported on Thursday that at least 29 people were killed in Israeli attacks – the majority of whom were Syrians in the town of Younine in the Bekaa valley, along the country’s eastern border with Syria.
Other attacks hit villages and towns in the country’s south, including Tyre, and at least two people were killed and 15 others were wounded in an attack in the suburbs of the capital Beirut, the ministry said.
The Israeli military said it killed Muhammad Hossein Sarur, whom it said was the head of the Lebanese armed group Hezbollah’s aerial unit, in the Beirut attack.
There was no immediate comment on the Israeli claim from Hezbollah.
In a series of statements on its Telegram channel on Thursday, Hezbollah said it fired more than 50 missiles at Ahihud, north of Haifa, and also fired barrages of rockets at Kiryat Shmona, military posts and a command base in different areas north of Israel. It said it used air defence weapons to force two Israeli warplanes to leave Lebanese airspace.
Thursday’s attacks came as Israeli officials appeared to reject growing international calls for a ceasefire. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said world powers wanted a ceasefire and that he would be meeting with Israeli officials in New York. And in London, US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin said that there was still room for diplomacy.
“So let me be clear, Israel and Lebanon can choose a different path, despite the sharp escalation in recent days, a diplomatic solution is still viable,” Austin said.
The United States and France put forward on Wednesday a proposal for an immediate 21-day ceasefire, expressing also support for a cessation of hostilities in Gaza. But Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu swiftly made clear that such options were not on the table.
“Our policy is clear: we’re continuing to strike Hizbollah with all [our] strength, and we won’t stop until we achieve all our objectives – first and foremost the return of the northern residents to their homes securely,” Netanyahu said as he landed in New York where he is due to address the UN General Assembly on Friday. “This is the policy. Let no one mistake it.”
Thursday’s attacks are the latest in a dramatic Israeli military escalation in recent days that has forced more than 90,000 people in Lebanon to flee their homes. Since Monday, a wave of Israeli air raids killed more than 600 people and wounded thousands of others across Lebanon.
It is the deadliest week of hostilities between Israel and Hezbollah since they began trading near-daily fire along the Israel-Lebanon border last October, when Hezbollah began firing rockets after Israel launched its assault on Gaza.
For months, the exchanges were relatively low-intensity and largely restricted to border areas, but Israel has increased its attacks dramatically recently after it said it would shift its military focus from Gaza to its northern border.
Israel’s stated goal of its offensive in Lebanon is the return of tens of thousands of civilians to their homes in the north who were displaced due to the cross-border fire.
Israel has claimed to have carried out a series of assassinations targeting Hezbollah’s military leadership. Last week, the Israeli army killed in two separate air attacks Ibrahim Aqil, along with 15 other senior commanders of the group’s elite Radwan unit, and Ibrahim Qobissi, the head of Hezbollah’s missiles division.
The killing of the group’s top ranks came after a mass detonation of communication devices owned by Hezbollah rank-and-file members and civilian officers sent shockwaves throughout the country, killing more 42 people and wounding thousands of others.
There are growing fears about whether Israel could launch a ground assault on Lebanon. In the most explicit reference to a potential ground assault, the army’s Chief of Staf Herzi Halevi told troops stationed in the north on Wednesday to be ready for a potential ground operation.
The post Israel launches new Lebanon attacks despite growing calls for ceasefire appeared first on Al Jazeera.
